abstract: Investors have raised $76 billion to buy noncore assets currently held by European banks, but there are still too few potential buyers for the mountain of loan portfolios that firms are looking to offload.
snippet: Investors have raised $76 billion to buy noncore assets currently held by European banks, but there are still too few potential buyers for the mountain of loan portfolios that firms are looking to offload.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — Is now a good time to invest in Europe? Some investors seem to think so.

headline.main: Investors Raise $76 Billion to Buy European Bank Assets
